body.content: وَلَا تَمْشِ فِي الْأَرْضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّكَ لَن تَخْرِقَ الْأَرْضَ وَلَن تَبْلُغَ الْجِبَالَ طُولًا
And do not walk arrogantly on the earth; undoubtedly, you will indeed never tear the earth apart and will never reach the mountains in height.

references.source: Kanz-ul-Iman (translation of Quran) (Part 15, Surah Bani Isra'eel, verse 37)

body.content: A person covered in two shawls strutted pridefully. Due to arrogance, he was made to sink into the ground — and will continue sinking until the Day of Judgement.
Sometimes while walking, the beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would hold the hand of his companion with his blessed hand.
When the beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would walk, he
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would walk stooping a little, and it seemed as if he
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
was coming down from a height.

Do not strut with your neck extended, wearing gold or any metal chain to show off. This resembles the behavior of the arrogant and is impermissible. It is Haraam for men to wear gold chains or bracelets. Wearing metal ones without need is also not allowed.

Walk at a moderate pace. Don't rush without reason or walk too slowly without cause. Do not hold the hand of a young, beardless boy or a good-looking young man. Lustful touching or gestures towards men is Haraam and leads to Hell.
Looking around unnecessarily while walking is not Sunnah. Walk in a dignified manner with eyes downcast.

content.content: Sayyiduna Hassan Bin Abi Sinnan
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

went to offer Eid Salah. When he returned, his wife asked, 'How many women have you seen today?' He remained silent. Upon her insistence, he said: 'I kept looking at the big toes (of my feet) from the time I went out of home until I returned to you.'
سُبْحَانَ الله
— this was the piety of the pious. Looking at a woman unintentionally is excused, but immediately turning away is necessary.

references.source: Kitab-ul-wara' Ma' Mawsua' Imam Ibn Abi Al-Dunya, vol. 1, p. 205

body.content: It is not appropriate to look towards the balcony or window of someone's house unnecessarily.
While walking or using stairs, ensure your footwear doesn't produce noise.
Do not pass between two women walking or standing together — it has been prohibited in Hadith.
Avoid spitting, nose-blowing, inserting fingers in your nose, or scratching private parts in public. These acts are against manners.
Avoid the bad habit of kicking items while walking — like boxes, papers, or bottles. You may injure yourself, and it may show disrespect, especially if there's writing on the object.
While walking, use zebra crossings or pedestrian bridges if available, especially where traffic is present.

Before crossing a road, check the direction of traffic. If you're already in the middle and a vehicle approaches, standing still might be safer than running. Never cross railway tracks during train times or at prohibited zones — especially near stations. Obeying traffic and safety laws is also an Islamic duty.
Walk for about 45 minutes daily, doing Zikr and sending Salawat upon the Prophet ﷺ, intending to stay healthy for worship.
إِنْ شَاءَ الله

content.content:
Suggested Routine:

First 15 mins: walk fast
Next 15 mins: moderate pace
Last 15 mins: fast again

Benefits: aids digestion, prevents flatulence, constipation, obesity, and heart diseases.
إِنْ شَاءَ الله

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Use shoes frequently because as long as a person is wearing shoes, he is like a rider (he feels less tired)."
Shake your shoes before wearing them so that if there is any insect, bone, or gravel inside, it comes out.

content.content: After attending a gathering, a man wore his shoes and screamed in pain — his foot bled. Someone had thrown a sharp bone during the meal, which landed inside the shoe. Because he didn't shake it before wearing, the bone injured him.

body.content: It is Sunnah to wear the right shoe first, then the left. When removing, take off the left shoe first, then the right.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

said: "When any one of you wears shoes, he should start wearing from the right side, and when he takes them off, he should start from the left side, so that the right foot will be the first when wearing [shoes] and the last when taking [them] off."
Men should wear men's shoes and women should wear women's shoes.
Someone humbly asked Sayyidatuna Bibi Aaishah Siddiqah
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهَا
about a woman wearing shoes like men. She replied: "The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has cursed mannish women (those who resemble men)."

content.content: Men and women are both forbidden from imitating each other in aspects that distinguish their genders.

body.content: When sitting, remove your shoes — this gives rest to the feet.
If you see a shoe upside down, put it the right way up.
Not correcting an overturned shoe — even after noticing it — is one of the causes of destitution.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The people who sit somewhere for a long period and disperse from there without doing zikr of Allah and reciting salat upon the beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
suffer a loss. If Allah Almighty wills, He may punish (them), and if He wills, He may forgive (them)."
Sayyiduna Ibn-e-'Umar
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُمَا
said: "I saw the beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
sitting in the courtyard of the sacred Ka'bah in the manner of ihtiba'."

content.content: Ihtiba': Sitting on one's hips with arms around the knees — a posture of humility.

body.content: Private parts should not become noticeable while sitting. Cover from knees to feet using a shawl or the Sunnah-style kurta (which reaches midway down the shin) for extra modesty.
After offering Fajr Salah, the Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would sit cross-legged until sunrise.
Imam Yusuf Nabhaani
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
had the habit of sitting kneeling (as in Attahiyyat).

content.content: It is better to sit kneeling, even outside Salah.

body.content: The Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Among majalis (gatherings), the most reverent majlis is that in which faces are towards Qiblah."

content.content: Sayyiduna Abdullah bin Umar
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُمَا
would often sit facing the Qiblah.

body.content: When delivering speeches or teaching, the Sunnah is to keep your back towards Qiblah so the audience faces it.

content.content: Sayyiduna Hafiz Sakhaawi
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
stated: "The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would sit with his blessed back towards Qiblah so that the people to whom he was advising would face Qiblah."

body.content: The Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
never extended his legs toward anyone — not children, wives, servants, or anyone in the gathering.

content.content: Imam A'zam Abu Hanifah
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
said: "I have never stretched my legs toward the home of my teacher Sayyiduna Hammad
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
out of reverence — even though several streets were between us."

references.source: Manaqib-ul-Imam al-A'zam Abi Hanifah, Part 2, p. 7

body.content: When someone arrives, move aside for them.

content.content: A man came while the Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
was sitting in the masjid. The Prophet moved aside. The man said: "Ya Rasoolallah! There is enough space." The Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
replied: "It is the right of a Muslim that when his brother sees him, he should move aside for him."

body.content: The Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "If anyone of you is in the shade and the shade goes away from above him and he is partly under the sun and partly under the shade, he should leave the place."
A'la Hadrat
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
wrote: "Do not sit at the seat where your spiritual guide or teacher sits — not even in their absence."
When arriving at a gathering, do not push forward by skipping over people's shoulders. Sit where there is available space.
When sitting, remove your shoes to let your feet rest.
Recite this supplication thrice after leaving a gathering for expiation of sins. If it's a gathering of zikr or goodness, this seals the reward:
سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْكَ
"You are Pure, O Allah! All praise is to You. There is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance."
بِسْمِ اللهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللهِ، لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللهِ
"In the name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah; there is no power and no strength except with Allah."

content.content: By the blessing of this supplication, you will be guided, protected from troubles, and Allah's help will remain with you, In Sha Allah.

body.content: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ الْمَوْلِجِ وَخَيْرَ الْمَخْرَجِ  بِسْمِ اللهِ وَلَجْنَا وَبِسْمِ اللهِ خَرَجْنَا وَعَلَى اللهِ رَبِّنَا تَوَكَّلْنَا
"O Allah! I ask You for goodness when entering and leaving. In Allah's name we enter and in Allah's name we exit, and upon our Lord, Allah, we place our trust."

content.content: After reciting, say Salam to your family and also send Salam upon the Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
, then recite Surah Al-Ikhlaas.
Your livelihood will be blessed and you'll be protected from family disputes, In Sha Allah.

sunnahs.title: Greet Family When Entering or Leaving

body.content: Say Salam to your maharim and muharramaat (e.g. parents, siblings, spouse, children) when entering or leaving home.
The devil enters the home with a person who enters without saying:
بِسْمِ اللّٰه
Even if it's your own house, say:
السَّلَامُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى عِبَادِ اللهِ الصَّالِحِينَ
"Peace be upon us and upon the righteous servants of Allah."

content.content: Or say:
السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ
"O Prophet, peace be upon you."
Because the blessed soul of the Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
is present in the homes of Muslims.

body.content: When entering someone else's home, say:
السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ
, May I come in?
If you're not given permission, return happily. Perhaps the owner has a valid reason.
If someone asks "Who is it?" respond with your name, e.g. "Muhammad Ilyas". Do not reply vaguely like: "It's me", "Open up", or just "Madinah!"
After introducing yourself, stand aside — not in front of the door — to avoid looking into the home when it's opened.
It is prohibited to look inside someone's home. E.g., if your balcony overlooks a lower-level house, avoid glancing inside.
When visiting someone's home, do not criticize their arrangements. This can hurt their feelings.

When leaving someone's home:

1. Make dua for the host
2. Thank them
3. Say Salam
4. If possible, gift a Sunnah-inspiring booklet or similar item
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

said:
"By virtue of the righteous Muslim, Allah Almighty removes a calamity from 100 houses in his neighborhood."
Then he
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
recited:
وَلَوْلَا دَفْعُ اللَّهِ النَّاسَ بَعْضَهُم بِبَعْضٍۢ لَّفَسَدَتِ الْأَرْضُ
"And if Allah does not keep away some people by means of others, the earth would have been corrupted."

sunnahs.title: Best Neighbor Is the One Who Wishes Well

body.content: "In the sight of Allah Almighty, the best neighbour is he who is a well-wisher of his neighbour."

sunnahs.title: Hurting the Neighbor Leads to Deprivation of Paradise

body.content: "He whose neighbour is not safe from his wrongful conduct will not enter Paradise."

content.content: One person humbly said to the Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

:
"So-and-so woman offers salah, fasts, and gives charity abundantly, but she hurts her neighbours with her tongue."
He
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

replied: "She is in Hell."

Then the person said:
"So-and-so woman prays little, gives bits of cheese in charity, and does not hurt her neighbours."
He
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
replied: "She is in Paradise."

body.content: "He who eats to his fill while his neighbour remains hungry is not a perfect believer."

sunnahs.title: Hurting a Neighbor Hurts the Prophet

body.content: "The person who causes pain to his neighbour causes pain to me, and the one who causes pain to me displeases Allah Almighty."

content.content: A person once said to Sayyiduna Abdullah Bin Mas'ood
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُ

:
"My neighbour gives me pain, abuses me, and treats me cruelly."
He replied: "If he disobeys Allah regarding you, then you obey Allah regarding him."

sunnahs.title: Jibra'eel Emphasized the Rights of Neighbors

body.content: "Jibra'eel (
عليه السلام
) continued to emphasize the rights of a neighbour to the extent that I thought he would make the neighbour an heir."
"The person who believes in Allah Almighty and the Judgement Day should treat his neighbour kindly."
"Forty houses are considered neighborhood."

content.content: Imam Zuhri
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

said:
"It means 40 houses in all four directions."

body.content: From Ihya'-ul-'Uloom by Imam Ghazali
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

:

1. Greet your neighbour first
2. Don't have long conversations
3. Don't ask excessive personal questions
4. Visit when ill, console during hardship, congratulate in joy
5. Forgive mistakes, don't look into their home
6. Don't block their path, don't spy on what they bring home
7. Conceal their faults
8. Help during accidents or need
9. Guard their home in absence
10. Don't listen to gossip about them
11. Lower gaze before their family
12. Speak gently to their children
13. Teach them in religious or worldly matters if they lack knowledge

On the Day of Judgment, a poor neighbour will hold the lower part of his rich neighbour's shirt and say:
"O my Lord! Ask him why he deprived me of good treatment and closed his door to me."

content.content:
A pious man had many mice in his house. Someone suggested getting a cat. He replied:
"I fear the mice will run to my neighbour's house because of the cat. I don't want to cause him what I don't want for myself."

sunnahs.title: Respect Across Faith and Family Lines

body.content:
"There are three types of neighbours:

1. A Muslim relative – three rights (neighbourhood, Islam, kinship)
2. A Muslim – two rights (neighbourhood, Islam)
3. A non-Muslim – one right (neighbourhood only)"

content.content: Sayyiduna Ba-Yazeed Bistami
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

had a Jewish neighbour whose child cried in the dark. When he learned they had no lamp, he sent a lit lamp daily with extra oil. Upon returning, the Jew's wife told him, and he said:
"How can there be darkness (of disbelief) in a house where Ba-Yazeed's light enters?"
They all embraced Islam.

sunnahs.title: Drink in Sips, Not in One Breath

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Do not drink [water] in one breath like a camel, but rather drink it in two or three breaths. Recite
بِسْمِ اللّٰه
before drinking it, and when you have drunk it, recite
آلحمد لله

sunnahs.title: Avoid Breathing or Blowing into the Container

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "He forbade breathing or blowing into a pot (container)."

content.content: Mufti Ahmad Yar Khan
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

said:

1. Breathing into a container is an animalistic habit.

2. Breath may contain harmful elements; therefore, move the container away from your mouth when pausing.

3. Do not blow into hot tea or milk to cool it. Wait for it to cool naturally before drinking.

4. Exception: Blowing onto water after reciting blessed supplications (e.g., Salat) with the intention of Shifa (healing) is permitted.

body.content: Always begin with the name of Allah when drinking water.
Drink in small sips rather than large gulps, which may cause liver disease.
Pause three times while drinking water. This was the blessed way of the Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

sunnahs.title: Use the Right Hand & Sit While Drinking

body.content: Drink water while seated and using the right hand, as this is from the manners taught in Sunnah.

sunnahs.title: Drink Leftover Wudu Water Standing Facing Qiblah

body.content:
Drinking the leftover water from wudu is a cure for 70 diseases, as it resembles Zamzam.

Drink while standing and facing Qiblah.

Except for Zamzam and Wudu water, drinking water while standing is makruh (disliked).

references.source: Derived from Fatawa Razawiyyah, vol. 4, p. 575; vol. 21, p. 669

body.content: Ensure nothing harmful is in the water or container before drinking.
Always praise Allah after drinking by saying
الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰه
Imam Al-Ghazali
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

advised when drinking water:

Before first sip:
بِسْمِ اللّٰه
After first breath:
الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰه
After second breath:
الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ الْعَٰلَمِينَ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ
After third breath:
الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ الْعَٰلَمِينَ

content.content: This is a recommended practice. If only
بِسْمِ اللّٰه
before and
الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰه
after is said, the Sunnah is fulfilled.

body.content: The leftover drinking water of a Muslim should not be discarded unnecessarily if the glass is still usable.

sunnahs.title: Cure in a Muslim's Leftover Water

body.content: It is narrated:
سورة المؤمنون شفاء
— "There is cure in a Muslim's leftover."

references.source: Al-Fatawa Al-Fiqhiyah, Ibn Hajar Al-Haytami, vol. 4, p. 117

body.content: After drinking, some water may gather at the bottom of the empty glass. These last drops should also be consumed — don't leave them behind.
Food should not be eaten only because it is tasty. Instead, make this intention: "I am eating food to gain strength in order to worship Allah Almighty."

Eating to one's fill is mubah (permissible) and carries no reward or sin, if done with a sound intention such as gaining strength. However:

1. Eating more than one's appetite is haram.
2. Excessive eating means eating so much that there's a strong presumption of resulting illness, such as diarrhoea or other discomforts.
Eating less than the appetite brings countless benefits. Doctors say that 80% of diseases are caused by overeating. So stop eating while you still feel a bit hungry.

sunnahs.title: Do Not Eat on Printed Dining Mats

body.content:
Avoid using dining mats that have:

1. Verses,
2. Company logos,
3. Printed text such as poetry.
This is a Sunnah.
The Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Making wudu (i.e. washing both hands up to the wrists) before and after eating increases sustenance and drives Satan away."
The Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "When you start eating food, take your shoes off, because it brings about comfort (i.e. rest) to your feet."

Three Sunnah positions while eating:

1. Left leg folded, right knee drawn up.
2. Both knees drawn up, sit on buttocks.
3. Sit on both insteps.

Men and women should adopt extra veiling while eating, such as:

1. Using a shawl.
2. Covering with the lower part of the kurta.

sunnahs.title: Do Not Place Curry on Roti

body.content: Avoid placing curry or cups of sauce directly on roti.
Eating food bare-headed is against etiquette and reduces sustenance.
It is makruh (disliked) to eat while leaning on the floor using the left hand for support.
It is mustahabb to eat in earthenware. "Angels visit the house of the one who gets earthen pots made."
"If there is a vegetable dish on the dining mat, angels descend."
Recite before eating:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ، وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ، يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ
"In the name of Allah, by Whose name nothing in the earth or the sky can cause harm. He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing. O Ever-Living, O Sustainer!"
If the food is poisoned,
إِنْ شَاءَ الله
this will protect you.
Say during the meal:
بِسْمِ اللهِ أَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ
"In the name of Allah in the beginning and the end."
Eating salt is a Sunnah and cures 70 diseases.

Using the left hand to:

1. Eat,
2. Drink,
3. Pass food,

...is the way of Satan. Even crumbs should be:

1. Picked with the left hand,
2. Then placed into the right hand before eating.

"Breaking bread with the right hand while holding it in the left eliminates arrogance."

Break bread over the middle of the plate so crumbs fall inside and are not wasted.
Use the middle finger, forefinger, and thumb. If rice grains are loose, it is allowed to use more fingers.

1. Take small bites.
2. Avoid chewing sounds.
3. Chew until food becomes soft.

This helps digestion and prevents illnesses.
Recite
يَا وَاجِدُ
after every 1–2 morsels. It creates nūr (light) in the stomach and removes diseases.
The Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

would lick:

1. Middle finger
2. Forefinger
3. Thumb

...three times.

"The plate prays: 'May Allah free you from Hell, as you have freed me from Satan.'"

Another narration: "The plate prays for your forgiveness."

"The one who licks the plate and drinks the rinsing water receives the reward of freeing a slave."

"It is the dowry of the heavenly maidens (Hoor) to pick up and eat the fallen crumbs."
"The person who picks and eats fallen morsels will live a prosperous life, and his children will be protected from difficulties."
اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ…
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا وَجَعَلَنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
"All praise belongs to Allah Who fed us, gave us drink, and made us Muslims."
اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَهُمْ فِيمَا رَزَقْتَهُمْ وَاغْفِرْ لَهُمْ وَارْحَمْهُمْ
"O Allah! Bless them in what You provided for them, forgive them, and have mercy on them."

1. Surah Al-Ikhlaas
2. Surah Al-Quraysh
"Washing both hands after eating protects from mental illness."

sunnahs.title: Respecting Guests Is a Sign of Faith

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The one who believes in Allah Almighty and the Judgement Day should respect a guest."

content.content: Mufti Ahmad Yar Khan
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
explained: "The respect for the guest is that one should meet him smilingly in a proper manner, arrange food and other services for him, serve him himself as much as possible."

sunnahs.title: Do Not Cause Discomfort to Guests

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The one who believes in Allah Almighty and the Judgement Day should not give pain to a guest."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "When a guest comes to someone, he brings his sustenance along with him, and when he leaves, he becomes the cause for the forgiveness of the sins of the host."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The one who offers salah, pays zakah, performs hajj, fasts in Ramadan and extends hospitality to his guest will enter Paradise."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The person who does not extend hospitality (despite having enough money) has no goodness."

references.source: Musnad Ahmad Bin Hanbal, vol. 6, p. 142, Hadith 17424

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "It is unwise of a person to make his guest work."

sunnahs.title: See Off Guests at the Door

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The Sunnah is that a person should see his guest off at the door."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "To a home in which food is eaten, goodness and blessings come faster than the reach of a knife to the hump of a camel."

content.content: Blessings remain in homes where guests, pilgrims, and visitors eat food. The hump of a camel has no bone but only fat, so a knife cuts through it very quickly. Similarly, goodness and blessings reach very quickly to such homes.

body.content: Sayyiduna Bibi Khadijah
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهَا
said: "He
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
gives his relatives excellent treatment, extends hospitality to travellers and for the sake of truth and justice helps everyone in their troubles and difficulties."
A person asked: "Ya Rasoolallah
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

! I visited a person. He did not extend hospitality to me. Now if he comes to me, should I take revenge on him?"

The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
replied: "No, but rather you extend hospitality to him."
Sayyiduna Ata'
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
said: "At the time of eating a meal, when there used to be no one to eat with Sayyiduna Ibrahim
عليه السلام
, he
عليه السلام
used to go out for one or two miles in search of a person so that he could find someone who could eat with him."
Sayyiduna Ikramah
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
said: "Sayyiduna Ibrahim Khalilullah's
عليه السلام
title 'Abu Daifan' (a greatly hospitable person) was famous. His house had four doors; he would keep looking at the doors expecting a visitor from any of them."
Sayyiduna Anas Bin Malik
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُ
said: "The angels of mercy do not come to the house in which guests do not come."
Mufti Ahmed Yar Khan
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

said: "Our guest is the one who comes to meet us from outside (i.e., from another city or country) whether we already know him or not. The person who comes to meet us from our own area or our own city for two or four minutes is a visitor, not a guest. He should be met properly and be given a light meal, but he should not be given a feast. The person who is not one of our acquaintances and who comes to us for his work is not a guest."
A guest should take care of his host's busy schedule and responsibilities.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

said: "The person who believes in Allah (Almighty) and the Judgment Day should respect his guest, should give him complete hospitality and get meals of a day prepared for him with care as much as possible and then entertain him for three days, and after three days it is sadaqah. It is not halal for a guest to continue to stay with his host due to which he (the host) may get into difficulties."
When you go to someone as a guest, it is better to take gifts for the host or his children with good intentions according to your means.
Allama Maulana Mufti Muhammad Amjad Ali A'zami
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

said:

Four things are necessary for a guest:

1. He should sit wherever he is offered a seat
2. Whatever is brought to him, he should be happy with it; he should not say: "I eat better than this at my home," or other words like this
3. He should not leave the place without the permission of the host
4. When he leaves the place, he should pray for the host
Regarding the house or food, a guest should not make any kind of criticism, nor should he give any kind of false praise.

sunnahs.title: Hosts Should Not Put Guests in Awkward Positions

body.content:
The host should not ask the guest questions that might lead them to tell lies, such as: "How is our home? Did you like our food or not?"

On such occasions, despite not liking the home or food, if the guest falsely praises out of respect, he will become a sinner.

The host should not ask his guest: "Did you eat to your fill or not?"

Here also is a danger of telling a lie in reply. The guest may say "I have eaten to my fill" despite having eaten less due to habit, diet, or other reasons, fearing the host might insist they eat more.

sunnahs.title: Do Not Force Food on Guests

body.content: Sometimes, a person is assigned to keep putting curry, meat, etc. on the guest's plate. This can trouble the guest if they wish to avoid certain foods but that person keeps serving them.

sunnahs.title: Offer But Don't Insist on More Food

body.content: The host should say to the guest from time to time, "Have more," but should not insist, lest the guest eat excessively due to the insistence which can be harmful.
Sayyiduna Imam Abu Hamid Muhammad Bin Muhammad Bin Muhammad Ghazali
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
said: "If your mate eats less, for persuading him, say: 'Please eat!' But, do not say this more than three times as it is insistence and is beyond the limits."
The host should not be completely quiet, nor should he disappear after placing food, but rather he should be present there.
Do not get angry with your servant in front of your guests.
The host should be busy entertaining his guest. He should not assign this responsibility to his servants as it is the Sunnah of Sayyiduna Ibrahim Khalilullah
عليه السلآم

content.content: There will be no accountability [on the Judgement Day for the food] for the person who eats with his [Muslim] brothers.

sunnahs.title: Etiquette for Those Who Eat Less

body.content: Sayyiduna Imam Abu Hamid Muhammad Bin Muhammad Bin Muhammad Ghazali
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
said: "When a person who eats less eats with others, he should start eating after some time, take small morsels and eat slowly so that he eats with other people until the end."

references.source: Mirqat-ul-Mafatih, vol. 8, p. 84, under the Hadith 4254

sunnahs.title: Avoid Showing Off by Eating Less

body.content: If someone stops eating so that others get impressed with him and consider him to be one who eats less than his appetite, he will be a hypocrite and will deserve the punishment of Hell.

If someone eats a bit more than his appetite because he is eating with the guest and knows if he stops eating, his guest will feel shy and will not eat to his fill, he is allowed to eat some more. However, it should not be to such an extent that he ends up with an upset stomach.

sunnahs.title: Divine Command to Maintain Family Ties

body.content: Allah Almighty has said:
وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ الَّذِي تَسَاءَلُونَ بِهِ وَالْأَرْحَامَ
(Part 4, Surah Al-Nisa, verse 1)
"And fear Allah in Whose name you ask for your rights, and fear the severing of the ties of kinship."

content.content: It is stated in 'Tafseer-e-Mazhari': i.e., Avoid cutting ties with relatives.

sunnahs.title: Kindness to Relatives Is a Sign of Faith

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "One believing in Allah Almighty and the Judgement Day should treat relatives with kindness."

sunnahs.title: Shade Under the Throne on Judgment Day

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "On the Day of Judgement, three types of people will be under the shade of the 'Arsh of Allah Almighty. One who treats relatives with kindness (will be among them)."

sunnahs.title: Breaking Family Ties Bars Paradise Entry

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "One who breaks relations will not enter Paradise."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

said: "The best among people is the one who recites the Holy Quran in abundance, is more pious, enjoins [people] to do good and forbids [them] to do evil the most and treats his relatives with kindness the most."

references.source: Musnad Imam Ahmad, vol. 10, p. 402, Hadith 27504

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Undoubtedly, the best sadaqah is that which is given for the relative who harbours enmity."

references.source: Musnad Imam Ahmad, vol. 9, p. 138, Hadith 23589

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Allah Almighty's mercy does not descend to the nation which has the people who cut ties with their relatives."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

said: "One who wants a palace to be built for him (in Paradise) and his rank to be raised should forgive the one who oppresses him, bestow upon the one who deprives him and maintain the relationship with the one who breaks off the relationship with him."

sunnahs.title: Ten Benefits of Treating Relatives Well

body.content: Sayyiduna Faqih Abu Al-lays Samarqandi
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

has said:

There are ten advantages of treating relatives well:

1. It pleases Allah Almighty
2. It makes people happy
3. It brings angels pleasure
4. Muslims praise that person
5. It gives pain to Satan
6. It increases life
7. It brings about blessing in sustenance
8. Deceased forefathers (i.e., Muslim father, grandfather) feel happy
9. It increases mutual love
10. Due to it, a person's reward increases after his own death because people pray for him to have wellbeing

From 'Bahar-e-Shari'at' vol. 3 (pages 558-560):

Treating relatives with kindness means establishing a relationship, i.e., to treat relatives kindly. The entire Ummah has formed a consensus that treating relatives with kindness is wajib and breaking off a relationship with relatives is haraam.

sunnahs.title: Which Family Members Deserve Our Care

body.content:
Who are the relatives with whom a good relationship is wajib?

Some blessed Islamic scholars have said they are zu-raham mahram, and some said it means zu-raham, whether they are mahram or not. And this second saying is more authentic.

In blessed Ahadith, we have been commanded to treat our relatives well without any condition. In the Holy Quran, (relatives) have been mentioned without any condition.

content.content: As there are different levels of relatives, there are different levels of kind treatment to relatives. The rank of parents is the highest, after them the rank of zu-raham mahram (i.e., the relatives with whom your nikah is haraam forever due to having a blood relationship with them), after this the remaining relatives in order of closeness to the relationship.

sunnahs.title: Ways to Treat Relatives with Kindness

body.content:
There are different types of kind treatment with relatives:

1. Giving them gifts
2. Helping them in work where they need your help
3. Saying salaam to them
4. Going to meet them
5. Spending time with them
6. Having conversations with them
7. Treating them kindly

If a person is in a foreign country, he should:

1. Send letters, contact by phone or internet to his relatives
2. Continue to be in contact with them so there is no detachment
3. If possible, return to his country and refresh his relationship with relatives

In this way, the love will increase.

Good treatment with relatives does not mean that if they treat you well, you should also treat them well. It is, in actual fact, called exchange, which means:

1. If they have sent you something, you also send them something
2. If they come to you, you go to them too

The best treatment towards relatives is that:

1. If they cut [relationship with you], you establish [it with them]
2. If they want to go away from you or become careless of you, you take care of the rights of the relationship which you have with them
It is a Sunnah to say salaam to a Muslim at the time of meeting him. (Islamic sisters should say salaam to Islamic sisters and their maharim.)

At the time of saying salaam, this intention should be in the heart that the wealth and honour of the person to whom I am about to say salaam is under my protection, and I know it is haraam to interfere in any of them.
No matter how many times you come across Muslims, come and go to any room, etc. in a day, it is an act of reward to say salaam to the Muslims who are present there.
It is a Sunnah to say salaam first.
One saying salaam first is the person who attains closeness to Allah Almighty.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "One saying salaam first is free from arrogance."
90 mercies descend upon the one who says salaam first, and 10 mercies descend upon the one who replies to the salaam.
One gets 10 virtues by saying
السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ
(i.e., peace be upon you)

.

If he adds
وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ
(and mercy from Allah [be upon you])

, he will get 20 virtues.

If he adds
وَبَرَكَاتُهُ
(and the blessings [be upon you])
, he will get 30 virtues.

content.content: Some people add the words
جَنَّةُ الْمَقَامِ وَدُوزَخُ الْحَرَامِ
to salaam, it is a wrong way, and this sentence is also wrong from the lexical point of view. Some venturesome people even
مَعَاذَ الله
utter jokingly to the extent that they say, "Your children are our slaves."

body.content: If someone says
السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ
to you, you should say
وَعَلَيْكُمُ السَّلَامُ

in reply.

If he says
السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ
, you should say
وَعَلَيْكُمُ السَّلَامُ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ

in reply.

If he says up to
وَبَرَكَاتُهُ
, you should also say that much because there is no further addition.
By saying
وَعَلَيْكُمُ السَّلَامُ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ
in reply, one can get 30 virtues.
It is wajib to reply to the salaam immediately and loud enough so that the person who has said salaam can listen to it.
Learn the correct pronunciation of salaam: As-Salaamu-A'laikum
السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ
And its reply: Wa-A'laikum-us-Salaam
وعليكم السلام
(و- ع-ليك-مس-سلام)
When two Muslims meet, it is a Sunnah to use both hands for a handshake.
Say salaam before shaking hands.
Say salaam on leaving; you can also shake hands.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

said: "When two Muslims shake hands at the time of meeting and ask about each other, Allah Almighty sends one hundred mercies between them, out of which 99 mercies are for the one meeting more warmly and asking about his brother in a proper manner."
Recite blessed salat while shaking hands.
إِنْ شَاءَ الله
Your past and future sins will be forgiven before you separate hands.
At the time of shaking hands, if possible, recite the following supplication after reciting salat-'alan-Nabi:
يَغْفِرُ اللهُ لَنَا وَلَكُمْ
Translation: May Allah Almighty forgive us and you!
The supplication that two Muslims make at the time of shaking hands will
ان شآءالله
be answered, and both will be forgiven before they separate their hands.
Shaking hands with each other removes enmity.

One can get reward if he says salaam to a Muslim, shakes hands with him or rather looks at him with affection.

The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Whoever looks at his Muslim brother with affection and does not have hatred for him in his heart, the previous sins of both will be forgiven before his look returns."
You can shake hands as many times as you meet.
Nowadays, some people shake hands with each other with only one hand or rather they only touch each other's fingers. All these are contrary to Sunnah.
It is makruh to kiss one's own hand after shaking hands.

content.content: However, if someone kisses his own hand for attaining blessings after shaking hands with a pious person, it is not disliked.
A'la Hadrat
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

has said: "If someone shakes hands with someone, and he kisses his own hands for getting blessings, it is not prohibited, so long as the person with whom he shakes hands is one of the personalities from whom people get blessings."

body.content: If shaking hands with a beautiful boy [or a man] leads to lust, it is not permissible to shake hands with him. If looking at him causes lust, even looking at him is also a sinful act.
At the time of shaking hands, the Sunnah is that both palms should be empty, having no handkerchief, etc. in the hand, and the palm should touch the palm.
Talk smilingly and cheerfully.
With the intention of pleasing Muslims, talk to elders with respect and to youngsters with affection.
إِنْ شَاءَ الله
You will earn reward, and you will be respected by both of them.
Talking loudly as if you are shouting is not a Sunnah.
With good intentions, make it your habit to talk to even small children with good manners.
إِنْ شَاءَ الله
Your manners will improve and children will also learn manners.

During the conversation, avoid these displeasing acts:

• Touching private parts
• Removing dirt from the body with fingers
• Repeatedly touching the nose in front of others
• Inserting a finger into the nose or ear
• Repeatedly spitting

These are not good acts; others find them disgusting.
Keep listening to the other person calmly as long as he is speaking. It is not a Sunnah to start saying what you want to say by cutting his talk short.
Do not laugh loudly while talking, rather in any situation. The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
never laughed.
Excessive talking and laughing aloud repeatedly destroy a person's awe.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has said: "When you see a person who has been granted the blessing of disinclination to this world and speaking less, then have his closeness and company, for he is blessed with wisdom."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has stated: "The one who keeps silent attains salvation."

content.content: It is stated in Mirat Sharif that Sayyiduna Imam Ghazali
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

has stated: There are four types of conversations:

a) Completely harmful

b) Completely beneficial

c) Both beneficial and harmful

d) Neither harmful nor beneficial

It is necessary to always refrain from a completely harmful conversation; do have a conversation that is completely beneficial. If a conversation is both beneficial and harmful, then be cautious because it is better to refrain from it. The fourth type of conversation is a waste of time. It is difficult to differentiate between these conversations; therefore, silence is better.

body.content: When speaking to someone, there should be a specific purpose of conversation, and always talk to people according to their psychology and mood.
Always avoid using foul and indecent language. Refrain from swearing.

content.content: Remember! Abusing a Muslim without Shar'i permission is absolutely haraam.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has said: "Paradise is haraam for the person who uses foul language."

references.source: Kitab-ul-Samt Ma' Mawsua' Al-Imam Ibn Abi Al-Dunya, vol. 7, p. 204, Raqm 325

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Allah Almighty likes a sneeze and does not like a yawn."

sunnahs.title: Dialog Between One Who Sneezes and Angels

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "When someone sneezes and says
الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰه
, angels say
رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
, and if he says
رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
, angels say:
يَرْحَمُكَ اللهُ
(May Allah Almighty have mercy on you!)

When sneezing:

1. Lower your head
2. Cover your mouth
3. Sneeze in a low voice

It is foolishness to sneeze loudly.
One should say
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
after sneezing.

content.content: It is stated in Khaza`in-ul-'Irfan with reference to Tahtaawi that it is a muakkadah [emphasized] Sunnah to praise Allah Almighty on sneezing.
It is better to say
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
or
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ

body.content: It is wajib for the listener to say
يَرْحَمُكَ اللهُ
(may Allah Almighty have mercy on you!)
immediately in an audible voice so that the one who has sneezed can hear it.
On hearing
يَرْحَمُكَ اللهُ
, the person who has sneezed should say:
يَغْفِرُ اللَّهُ لَنَا وَلَكُمْ
(may Allah Almighty forgive us and you!)
OR
يَهْدِيكُمُ اللهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ
(may Allah Almighty guide you and improve your condition!)
Whoever passes his tongue over all his teeth after sneezing,
إن شآءالله
he will stay safe from dental diseases.

sunnahs.title: Protection from Molar and Ear Pain

body.content: Sayyiduna 'Ali
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُ
has said: "Whosoever says
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ
on sneezing, he will never suffer from molar pain and earache."

references.source: Mirqat-ul-Mafatih, vol. 8, p. 499, under the Hadith 4739

body.content: The one sneezing should praise Allah Almighty [i.e., say
حَمْد
] loudly so that somebody can listen to it and then respond to it.
The reply to a sneeze is wajib on the first sneeze. If the one sneezing says
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
on the second sneeze as well, it is not wajib to reply, but rather it is mustahab.

sunnahs.title: Reply Only When حَمْد Is Said

body.content: The reply will become wajib only when the one sneezing says
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
; if he does not say
حَمْد
, there is no reply.
If someone sneezes during the Friday sermon, the one hearing it should not reply to him.

sunnahs.title: When Many People Hear a Sneeze

body.content: If there are many Islamic brothers present and some have replied, their reply will be sufficient on behalf of everyone. However, it is better for everyone to reply.
If one sneezes behind a wall and says
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
, then the one hearing it should reply.

If someone sneezes during salah:

1. He should remain silent
2. If he says
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ

, it will not affect his salah
3. If he does not utter hamd during the salah, it should be uttered after completing the salah

sunnahs.title: Responding to a Sneeze While Praying

body.content: If someone sneezes while you are offering salah and you say
يَرْحَمُكَ اللهُ
with the intention to reply, your salah will become invalid.
If a disbeliever says
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
on sneezing, one should say
يَهْدِيكُمُ اللهُ
(may Allah Almighty guide you!)
in reply.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The best kohl among all is 'Ismid' as it improves the vision and causes eyelashes to grow."
There is no harm in using the kohl made of stone. It is, however, makruh for men to use black kohl or kajal with the intention of adornment, but it is not disliked if adornment is not the intention.
It is a Sunnah to use kohl while going to sleep at night.

Here is the summary of the three narrated methods of using kohl:

1. Sometimes, apply it thrice to each eye.

2. Sometimes, apply it thrice to the right eye and twice to the left.

3. Sometimes, apply it twice to each eye and at the end, take the applier and put it into the container so that the kohl gets onto it, then use the same applier to each eye one by one.
ان شآءالله
Applying in this way will fulfil all three methods.
O the devotees of Rasool! The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
used to begin all honourable acts from the right side, so apply kohl to the right eye first and then to the left eye.
Shake out the bedding properly before sleeping so that if there is any harmful insect etc., it can get off.
Recite this supplication before sleeping:
اَللّٰھُمَّ بِاسْمِكَ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا

content.content: "O Allah Almighty! I die and live with Your name (i.e., sleep and wake up)."

body.content: Do not sleep after 'Asr as there is fear of losing intellect.

content.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has said: "Whoever sleeps after 'Asr and loses his intellect should blame himself."

references.source: Musnad Abu Ya'la, vol. 4, p. 278, Hadith 4897

body.content: It is mustahab to nap in the afternoon.
It is makruh to sleep at the beginning of the day or between Maghrib and 'Isha.

sunnahs.title: Sleep in a State of Purity

body.content: It is mustahab to sleep in the state of purity.
First sleep on the right side [of the body] facing Qiblah with the right hand under the right cheek for some time, and then sleep on the left side.

sunnahs.title: Remember Death While Going to Sleep

body.content: Remember your grave as you go to sleep, as we will be alone in the grave and there will be no one but our deeds.
Get busy with the remembrance of Allah Almighty at the time of sleeping.

content.content: Recite
سبحان الله
لا اله الا الله
and
الله اكبر
until you fall asleep, for a person rises in the same state in which he sleeps, and he will be raised in the same state on the Day of Judgement in which he dies.

body.content: Recite this supplication after waking up:
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ

content.content: "All praise is to Allah Almighty Who gave us life after death and to Him we have to return."

body.content: Make a firm intention on waking up that you will become abstinent and pious and will not annoy others.
When boys and girls get to the age of 10, make them sleep separately. A boy of this age should neither sleep with the boys of the same age nor with men older than him.
When a husband and his wife sleep in the same bed, they should not have a ten-year-old child sleep beside them. The rulings on men will apply to a boy when he becomes mature enough to feel lust.
Use miswak after waking up.
Offer Tahajjud after waking up in the night as it is a privilege to do so.

content.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has said: "After fard salahs, the superior salah is the salah of night."

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

kept different hair lengths at various times:

1. Sometimes his hair reached halfway down his ears
2. Sometimes it reached his earlobes
3. Other times it reached his shoulders

content.content: It is recommended to follow each of these three Sunnahs at different times. The Sunnah of growing hair to the shoulders may be more challenging for our nafs, but everyone should try to practice it at least once or twice in life.

Take care that hair should not go below the shoulders. The length of hair can be correctly seen when wet. When growing your hair for this Sunnah, comb your hair after showering to ensure it doesn't exceed shoulder length.

body.content: My master A'la Hadrat
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
stated: "It is haraam for men to grow hair below shoulders like women."

content.content: Allamah Maulana Mufti Muhammad Amjad 'Ali A'zami
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

stated: "It is not permissible for a man to grow long hair like women. Some men claiming to be Sufis [mystics] grow extremely long hair which hangs on their chest like a snake and some of them braid their hair or wear their hair in a bun similar to women. All these are impermissible and against Shari'ah. Growing hair and wearing colourful dresses are not signs of mysticism, but rather it is in obeying the beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
completely and overcoming the desires of nafs."

body.content: It is haraam for a woman to get her head shaved.

content.content: It is impermissible and a sin for a woman to get her hair cut like disbelieving women; it has also been cursed. The same ruling applies even if a husband asks his wife to do so. A woman will become a sinner if she does it, because no one [mother, father or husband, etc.] should be obeyed if it involves disobeying Shari'ah.
Do not get small girls' hair cut similar to boys' haircuts. From childhood, train them to have hair like women.

references.source: Khulasah Az Fatawa Razawiyyah, vol. 22, p. 664

body.content:
Some people make the parting of their hair either to the right or left side. This is against the Sunnah.

If one has hair on the head, the Sunnah is to make a center parting.
Men have the choice to either get their heads shaved or grow their hair and make the parting.

content.content: Both practices were done by the Beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
. Although having the head shaved is proven to have been done at the time of getting out of ihram, it is not proven on other occasions.
Nowadays, hair is cut in particular styles using scissors or machines, making some parts long and others short. Such hairstyles are not Sunnah.

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Whoever has hair should honor them."

content.content: This means to wash, oil, and comb the hair properly.

body.content: Sayyiduna Ibraheem Khalilullah
عليه السلام
was the first to trim the hair of a mustache and the first to see a white hair. He
عليه السلام

humbly asked, "O Lord! What is this?"

Allah Almighty replied, "O Ibraheem! This is your grandeur."

He
عليه السلام
then humbly said, "O my Lord! Increase my grandeur."

content.content: Mufti Ahmad Yar Khan
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

said: "Before him, the mustaches of any prophet either did not grow, or if they grew, they (the prophets) trimmed them, but they were not commanded by Shariah to cut their mustaches in their religions. Now by virtue of him, this act has become Ibrahimi Sunnah."

body.content: It is an innovated act to get the hair shaved or plucked from both sides of the hair which is between the lower lip and the chin.

content.content: It is makruh to get the hair on the nape of the neck shaved.

This applies when one only gets the hair on the nape of the neck shaved and not the hair of the head. Many people get the hair on the nape of the neck shaved when they have their beards trimmed in a Sunnah-compliant way. If the hair on the entire head is shaved, then along with this, the hair on the nape of the neck should also be shaved.

body.content:
We have been commanded to bury four things:

1. Hair
2. Nails
3. The piece of cloth that a woman uses for cleaning menstrual blood
4. Blood
It is mustahab for men to turn the white hairs of the beard or head reddish or yellowish. For this purpose, henna can be used.

sunnahs.title: The Prophet's Method of Applying Oil

body.content: Sayyiduna Anas
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُ
has said: "The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would often apply oil to his blessed head and comb his blessed beard. He
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would often put a cloth over his blessed head, and even that cloth would become dampened with oil."

content.content: From this, it has been learnt that the use of 'sarband' (head cloth) is a Sunnah. Islamic brothers should wear a small piece of cloth over their heads whenever they oil their heads. By this,
إِنْ شَاءَ الله
, the cap and imamah will remain protected from oiliness.

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Whoever has hair should respect it."

content.content: This means one should wash, oil, and comb their hair properly.

The hair and beard of those who do not wash them with soap, etc. usually give off an unpleasant smell. If an unpleasant smell comes from your mouth, hair, body, clothes, etc., it is haraam to enter masjid in this state because it causes trouble to people and angels.

body.content: Sayyiduna Naafi'
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُ
has narrated: "Sayyiduna Ibn 'Umar
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُمَا
used to oil [his hair] twice a day."

content.content: Oiling hair frequently is useful especially for intellectuals as it keeps dandruff away, refreshes the brain, and strengthens the memory.

references.source: Musannaf Ibn Abi Shaybah, vol. 6, p. 117

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has said: "When anyone of you applies oil, he should begin with eyebrows. It relieves headache."

sunnahs.title: The Prophet's Method of Applying Oil

body.content: Whenever our beloved Rasool
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
applied oil, he
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

would:

1. First pour oil onto his left palm
2. Then oil both blessed eyebrows
3. Then both blessed eyes [i.e. his blessed eyelashes]
4. And then his blessed head
It is narrated in Tabarani: When the beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
oiled his blessed beard, he
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would begin with the hair between the lower lip and the chin.
It is a Sunnah to comb the beard.
It is against Sunnah to apply oil without reciting
بِسْمِ اللّٰه
and to keep hair uncombed.
It is stated in a blessed Hadith: 70 devils accompany the one who applies oil without reciting
بِسْمِ اللّٰه

content.content: Hujjat-ul-Islam Sayyiduna Imam Ghazali
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
narrated that Sayyiduna Abu Hurayrah
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُ

said:

Once, a devil accompanying a believer met a devil accompanying a disbeliever. The devil accompanying the disbeliever was healthy and well-dressed, whereas the devil accompanying the Muslim was weak, undressed, and his hair was uncombed.

The devil accompanying the disbeliever asked, "Why are you so weak?"

He replied, "I accompany such a person who recites
بِسْمِ اللّٰه
before eating and drinking, so I am left hungry and thirsty. He recites
بِسْمِ اللّٰه

before applying oil, so my hair is left uncombed."

Upon hearing it, the devil accompanying the disbeliever said, "I accompany such a person who does nothing [i.e. does not recite
بِسْمِ اللّٰه
before carrying out these acts], so I get involved with him in eating, drinking, dressing and applying oil."

references.source: 'Amal al Yaum Wa Lailah, p. 327, Hadith 173

body.content:
Before applying oil:

1. Recite
بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ

2. Pour some oil onto the left palm
3. First oil the eyebrow of the right eye, then of the left eye
4. Then the eyelashes of the right eye, then of the left eye
5. Then oil the hair
6. If oiling the beard, begin with the hair grown between the lower lip and the chin

When the one using oil takes his cap or imamah off, sometimes a smell comes. Those who use mustard oil should be very careful. Therefore, whoever can afford it should apply fragrant oil to his head.

An easy way to make fragrant oil is to add a few drops of your favorite 'itr to the bottle of coconut oil and dissolve it; the fragrant oil will be ready. Wash the hair of your head and beard with soap frequently.
Women must hide the hairs that fall while combing or washing so that such a man to whom nikah is not haraam does not see them.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has forbidden to comb [hair] daily.

content.content: This prohibition is (makruh) tanzeehi, and the purpose is that a man should not remain busy adorning himself.
Imam Munaawi
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
has said: "If one needs to due to a mop of hair, he can absolutely comb [his hair] daily."

body.content: Question asked to A'la Hazrat
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

: "At what time should the beard be combed?"

Answer: "There is no particular time appointed in Shari'ah to comb [hair]. It has been commanded to adopt moderation; neither should a man make himself look like a jinn, nor should he remain busy adorning himself all the time."

Begin with the right side when combing [hair].

Umm-ul-Mu'mineen, Sayyidatuna 'Aaishah Siddiqah
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهَا
has said: "The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
liked to begin doing everything with the right side; even wearing shoes, combing [hair], and cleaning."

content.content: Regarding this blessed Hadith, Allama Badruddin 'Ayni Hanafi
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

has written:

"These three things have been cited just as examples, otherwise, it is mustahab to begin every respectable and graceful act with the right side. Such as entering a masjid, wearing a dress, using a miswak, applying kohl, trimming nails and cutting moustaches, shaving armpits, performing wudu, having a bath, leaving a toilet, etc.

And the acts which are not related to grace, like leaving a masjid, entering a toilet, blowing nose, removing trousers and dresses, it is mustahab to begin with the left side."

body.content: It is mustahab to apply oil and fragrance for Jumu'ah Salah.

It is not makruh to apply oil to the beard and moustaches when fasting. However, if one applies oil with [the intention] to grow a beard despite the fact that he already has a fist-length beard, it is makruh even if he is not fasting, and a higher degree of makruh if he is fasting.
It is impermissible and a sin to comb the hair of the beard or head of the deceased.

content.content: People shave the beard of the deceased. It is also impermissible and a sin. The deceased will not be a sinner, but rather the one who shaves it and orders to shave it will be a sinner.

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Two rak'aat offered after using miswak are superior to 70 rak'aat without miswak."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Make it compulsory for yourself to use Miswak, because it causes cleanliness to the mouth and pleases Allah Almighty."

references.source: Musnad Imam Ahmad Bin Hanbal, vol. 2, p. 438, Hadith 5869

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would use miswak many times every night. He
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would use miswak every time when he
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
would go to sleep and wake up.

Without good intentions, if you do miswak, you will get natural benefits but no reward. For example, if you have to do miswak for wudu, make three intentions like this:

1. To make my mouth clean for pleasing Allah Almighty
2. To perform Sunnahs
3. To do zikr and recite blessed Salat
Respectable Islamic scholars say that the one who uses miswak regularly will be blessed with the recitation of Kalimah at the time of his death.
Sayyiduna Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas
رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُ

has narrated that there are ten qualities of miswak:

1. It cleans the mouth
2. Strengthens gums
3. Improves eyesight
4. Eliminates phlegm
5. Eliminates bad breath
6. It is the observance of Sunnah
7. Angels become happy
8. Allah Almighty gets pleased
9. It increases virtues
10. It improves the functions of the stomach
Sayyiduna 'Abdul Wahhab Sha'rani
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

narrated:

Once, Sayyiduna Abu Bakr Shibli Baghdadi
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
needed a miswak whilst performing wudu. He looked for it but could not find it. So, he
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

bought a miswak for one dinar (i.e. a gold coin) and used it.

Some people said to him, "You have spent too much on it! Should one spend so much on a miswak?"

He
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

replied, "Without doubt, this world and all that it contains are not even of the value equivalent to the wing of a mosquito in the court of Allah Almighty. How will I answer if, on the Day of Judgement, Allah Almighty asks me, 'Why did you abandon the Sunnah (miswak) of My beloved Rasool? The reality of the money and wealth that I gave you was not even equivalent to that of the wing of a mosquito, so after all, why did you not spend such unimportant wealth for carrying out that great Sunnah (miswak)?'"
Sayyiduna Imam Shafi'i
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

has stated: "Four things enhance intellect:

1. Avoiding useless conversation
2. Using miswak
3. Company of pious people
4. Acting upon your knowledge."

1. Miswak should be from Peelu, olive, Neem, or other trees having a bitter taste
2. The thickness should be equal to that of the little finger
3. It should not be longer than one hand span (otherwise, Satan sits on it)
4. The strands should be soft (hard strands can cause gaps between teeth and gums)
5. Fresh miswak is best; otherwise soak it briefly in water to soften
6. Trim its strands every day to maintain effectiveness

1. Brush your teeth horizontally with the miswak
2. Use miswak at least three times each session
3. Rinse it after each use

Hold miswak in the right hand so that:

1. The little finger remains at the bottom
2. The middle three fingers remain on top of it
3. The thumb remains on the top (near the soft strands)

Follow this cleaning order:

1. Upper teeth of the right side, then the left
2. Lower teeth starting from the right side, then the left
Using Miswak by holding it in a fist poses the risk of piles.
Miswak is not included in wudu; it is a Sunnah before wudu. However, it is Sunnat-ul-muakkadah only when someone has a foul smell in his mouth.

references.source: Derived from: Fatawa Razawiyyah, vol. 1, p. 623

body.content:
Do not throw away a used miswak as it is an instrument used to act upon a Sunnah. Instead:

1. Keep it somewhere respectfully
2. Bury it
3. Put it into the sea after tying it to a stone or something heavy

sunnahs.title: Friday Is Preferred for Nail Cutting

body.content: It is mustahab to clip nails on Friday. However, one should not wait for Friday if his nails have grown long.

content.content: Whosoever clips his nails on Friday, Allah Almighty will protect him from calamities until the next Friday and for three days thereafter, i.e. for ten days.
It has also been narrated: Whosoever clips his nails on Friday, mercy will be showered [upon him] and [his] sins will be removed.

body.content: Following is the summary of the narrated method of cutting fingernails: Begin with the index finger of the right hand and cut your nails in order up to the little finger but do not cut your thumb nail. Now, beginning with the little finger of the left hand, cut your nails in order including that of the thumb. In the end, cut the nail of the right thumb.

No specific order of cutting toenails has been narrated. It is better to start from the smallest toe on the right foot and cut in order, including the big toe, then cut the nails of the left foot in order, beginning with the big toe including that of the small toe.

sunnahs.title: Avoiding Nail Cutting in State of Impurity

body.content: It is makruh [tanzeehi] to cut nails in the state of impurity, i.e. when taking a bath is obligatory.
It is makruh [tanzeehi] to bite nails with teeth. There is a fear of getting leucoderma in doing so.
Bury the nails after cutting them. They can also be thrown away.
It is makruh [tanzeehi] to throw nails in the toilet or bathroom as this causes diseases.

Nails should not be cut on Wednesday as this may cause leucoderma. However, if someone has not cut his nails for 39 days and Wednesday happens to be the 40th day, it is wajib for him to cut his nails on that day [Wednesday] as it is impermissible and makruh tahreemi to keep nails uncut for more than forty days.
Long nails are a sitting place for Satan, i.e. Satan sits on long nails.

sunnahs.title: Permissibility of Cutting Nails at Night

body.content: There is no harm in cutting nails at night.

content.content: Haroon Rasheed asked Imam Abu Yusuf
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
about cutting nails at night. He replied, 'It is permissible.' Haroon Rasheed asked about evidence. He replied, 'It is stated in a blessed Hadith:
الْخَيْرُ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ
i.e. Do not delay carrying out the act of goodness.'

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The shield between the eyes of jinns and the satr of people is that when anyone takes off his clothes, he should recite
بِسْمِ اللّٰه

content.content: Mufti Ahmad Yar Khan
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه

stated: "As a wall and curtains become a barrier to people's act of seeing, this zikr of Allah Almighty will similarly become a barrier to jinns' act of seeing. Jinns will not be able to see them (private parts)."

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Whoever puts his clothes on and recites the following, his future and past sins will be forgiven."
الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي كَسَانِي هَذَا وَرَزَقَنِيهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلَا قُوَّةٍ
All praise is for Allah Almighty Who has made me wear this clothing and has bestowed upon me without my strength and power.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Despite having the means to wear elegant clothes, whoever avoids them due to humility, Allah Almighty will clothe him in Heavenly dress."
If a rich person wears a nice dress that is permitted in Shariah with the intention to express the bounty bestowed by Allah Almighty, he will deserve reward.
The blessed dress of the beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
was often of white cloth.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The best of that in which you meet Allah in your graves and mosques are white clothes."

content.content: It is good to offer salah in white clothes and make the deceased wear a white shroud.

body.content: Imam Shafi'i
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
said: "The sorrow of the person who keeps his dress clean will decrease and the intellect of the person who applies fragrance will increase."
Clothing should be of halal earnings, and no salah – whether fard and nafl – is accepted if it is offered wearing the clothing [bought] with haraam earnings.
It is narrated: Whoever ties his imamah while sitting or wears his lower garment (i.e. pyjamas or shalwar) while standing, Allah Almighty will make him have such a disease for which there is no cure.
Sayyiduna Imam Burhanuddin Zarnooji
رَحْمَةُ اللهِ عَلَيْه
wrote: "Tying imamah while sitting or wearing trousers or shalwar while standing are the causes of destitution."

When putting clothes on, start from the right side (because it is a Sunnah). For example, when putting on a kurta, put your right hand into the right sleeve first and then your left hand into the left sleeve.

Similarly, when putting on pyjamas, put your right leg into the right pantleg first and then your left leg into the left pantleg, and when taking off clothes (kurta or pyjamas), do the opposite, i.e. start from the left.
It is Sunnah to have the length of a kurta to halfway down the shin and the length of the sleeve up to the fingertips at most, and its width should be one hand span.
It is a Sunnah for men to keep their tahband or pyjamas above their ankles.

Men should wear only gents' clothing and women only ladies' clothing. This difference should also be kept in view when dressing small children (otherwise, those who make them wear the dresses will be sinners). However, the dress which is worn by both men and women and children (male and female) can be worn by both if the Shariah permits.
The part of man's body from below the navel down to below the knees is 'awrah, i.e. concealing it is fard. The navel is not included in it, but the knees are included.

These days, many people wear pyjamas or tahband from below the navel in such a way that some part (i.e. below the navel) remains uncovered. If the kurta etc. covers that area to such an extent that the colour of the skin is not visible, it is fine, otherwise it is haraam. If one-fourth of such part remains uncovered in salah, the salah will not be valid.
The one who is wearing ihram should take great care of it.

Nowadays, some people roam around wearing shorts, exposing their knees and thighs in public. This is haraam. Looking at the exposed knees and thighs of such people is also haraam. Beaches, playgrounds and gyms are especially the common places of these scenes. Therefore, one must take great care if he has to go to such places.
The dress that is worn to show arrogance is forbidden.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Two rak'aat of salah offered wearing an 'imamah are better than offering 70 rak'aat without wearing an 'imamah."

content.content: "Offering salah wearing an 'imamah is equivalent to 10,000 virtues."
"One Salat-ul-Jumu'ah offered wearing an 'imamah is equivalent to 70 Salat-ul-Jumu'ah offered without an 'imamah."

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

said: "Wearing an 'imamah over a cap is the difference between us and polytheists. For every fold of the 'imamah that a Muslim makes around his head, he will be given one noor on the Day of Judgement."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Undoubtedly, Allah
عَزَّوَجَلَّ
and His angels send salat on Friday upon those who wear an 'imamah."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Imamahs are the crowns of Arabs, so tie 'imamah, your dignity will be enhanced. Whoever wraps an 'imamah gains one virtue for every fold [of the 'imamah that he makes around his head]."
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "Wear an imamah, your forbearance will increase."

content.content: By wearing an imamah, your forbearance will increase and your chest will become wide, because if a person's appearance is good, it makes him serious and dignified and saves him from being emotional and from cheap activities.

references.source: Fayz-ul-Qadeer, vol. 1, p. 709, under the Hadith 1142

body.content: On page 660 of Bahar-e-Shari'at, vol. 3, it is stated: "Wear an imamah while standing, and put on pyjamas while sitting. Whoever does the opposite (i.e. wears an 'imamah while sitting, and puts on pyjamas while standing,) will have such a disease for which there is no cure (i.e. doctors do not know about its cure)."

content.content: "Tie the 'imamah while standing, facing Qiblah."
It is stated in Mirat Sharif: "Whether you tie the imamah in a masjid or any other place, it is a Sunnah to wear it while standing."

body.content:
Before wearing an imamah make good intentions. If there is not a single good intention, reward will not be given.

Make the following intentions as per the situation:

1. Acting upon Sunnah
2. Wearing the imamah for the pleasure of the Almighty
3. Dressing up well for salah (if preparing for prayer)
It is appropriate to make the first fold of the 'Imamah from the right side of the head.
The shimlah [i.e. the loose end] of the blessed 'imamah of the beloved Rasool
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم

would generally hang behind (on his blessed back), sometimes it would be on the right-hand side, and sometimes there would be two shimlahs between both of his blessed shoulders. To keep the shimlah on the left-hand side is against the Sunnah.

The minimum length of the shimlah of an 'imamah should be four fingers.

And the maximum length should be (down to the middle of the back, i.e. approximately) equal to the length of one arm.

(From the tip of the middle finger to the elbow is called the length of one arm.)
The Sunnah of 'imamah is that it should not be shorter than 2½ yards and nor should it be longer than 6 yards, and it should be tied in a dome-like shape.

content.content: If you have a large kerchief with which you can make enough folds to cover the whole head, it will be considered an 'imamah.
It is makruh to tie a small kerchief with which one can only make one or two folds.

body.content: If you want to tie the imamah afresh, untie it as you tied it. Do not take it off all at once.

content.content: If you have to take it off and you have the intention to tie it again, untie each fold one by one. If you do it, one sin of yours will be removed for untying each fold.

body.content: Protection from Environmental Elements:

content.content: Cold and hot weather, sun, etc. directly affect the hair of bareheaded people. They not only affect their hair, but also their brain and face and may also harm their health. Therefore, if you wear an imamah with the intention to follow the Sunnah, you will find peace in both worlds.
Relief from Headache: According to medical research, it is useful to wear an imamah for relieving headache.
Strengthens Brain and Memory: An imamah gives strength to the brain and makes memory strong.

Protection from Illness: By wearing an Imamah, one does not suffer from chronic cold, or if he suffers, it has less effect on him. The shimlah of an imamah protects a person from the paralysis of the lower body because it protects the spinal cord from seasonal effects, such as cold, heat, etc.
Prevents Brain Swelling: The shimlah reduces the risk of the disease of phrenitis. Phrenitis is the disease of swelling in the brain.

body.content: The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
has forbidden wearing a gold ring.

It is haraam to have a non-pubescent (very small) boy wear gold and silver jewellery, and the one having the non-pubescent boy do so will be a sinner. Similarly, it is impermissible to apply henna unnecessarily to the hands and feet of children (i.e. boys). A woman can apply it to her hands and feet, but if she applies it to a boy, she will be a sinner.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The iron ring is the jewellery of the Hell-dwellers."

It is permissible for men to wear only a gent's ring, i.e., one with only one gem. If there is more than one gem or there are many gems, then it will be impermissible for men even if it is made of silver.
It is impermissible to wear a gem-less ring, because it is not in the category of a ring with a gem.

It is permissible to wear the ring on which Huroof-e-Muqatta'at are inscribed, but it is not permissible to wear and touch this kind of ring without wudu. It is also not permissible for the one shaking hands to touch such a ring at the time of shaking hands without wudu.

sunnahs.title: Number of Rings and Women's Rings

body.content: It is impermissible for men to wear more than one (permissible) ring or one or more gem-less rings, because a gem-less ring differs from a ring with a gem. Women can wear gem-less rings.

Even without the need of using the ring as a stamp, it is permissible to wear a silver ring that weighs less than 4.5 masha [i.e., 4 grams and 374 mg] and has only one gem. However, for the one who does not need to use it as his official stamp, it is preferable not to wear even the permissible ring.

content.content: For those who need to use it as an official stamp, not only is this type of ring permissible, but it is also a Sunnah to wear it for that purpose. However, if somebody wears it for showing arrogance or adopting a feminine style or for any other evil intention, it will not be permissible to wear even good clothes, let alone a ring.

body.content: On the occasions of Eid, it is mustahab for men to wear a permissible ring.

Wearing a ring is a Sunnah only for those who need to use it as an official stamp, such as the king, the judge and the Islamic scholars stamping Fatawa (with the ring). Except for these people, it is not a Sunnah for those not needing to use it as an official stamp, though it is permissible to wear it.

content.content: Nowadays rings are no longer used as stamps, but rather a particular stamp is made for this purpose. Therefore, it is no longer a Sunnah to wear a ring even for the judges, etc., who do not need to use it as a stamp.

sunnahs.title: How to Wear Rings for Men and Women

body.content: Men should wear the ring in a way that the gem remains towards the palm while women should keep the gem on the back of the hand.
A silver ring without a gem is a piece of jewellery typically worn by women and, for men, it is makruh (tahreemi, impermissible and a sin).
Women can wear as many silver and gold rings as they like, whether with or without a gem. For them, there is no limit on the weight [of silver and gold] and the number of gems.
If an iron ring is plated with silver so that the iron is not visible at all, it is not prohibited [for man and woman both] to wear such a ring.

sunnahs.title: Which Finger to Wear the Ring On

body.content: One can wear the ring on any finger of one hand, but one should wear it on the little finger.

It is impermissible and a sin for men to wear a metal bracelet even related to mannat (a religious vow) or dam.

It is not permissible to wear a gem-less ring made of silver or any other metal or a steel ring brought from Madinah Munawwarah or the sacred city of Ajmer etc.

It is not permissible for men to wear a silver ring or any other metal ring without a gem on which dam has been made for the cure of piles and other diseases.

If an Islamic brother is wearing a bracelet, a gem-less ring made of any metals, an impermissible ring or a metal chain of any type, he should remove it without delay and repent immediately of it and make an intention of not wearing it anymore.
The beloved Prophet
صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم
said: "The boy is pawned for his aqeeqah. An animal should be sacrificed on his behalf on the seventh day, he should be named and his head should be shaved."

content.content: Being "pawned" means full benefits will not be obtained from the child unless his aqeeqah is performed. Some muhaddiseen have said that a child's safety, growth, and good attributes are associated with aqeeqah.
Aqeeqah is when an animal is slaughtered in gratitude for the birth of a child.

body.content: When a child is born, it is preferable to call azan and iqamat in their ears. Calling azan will remove afflictions
إنشآءالله

.

It is better to call azan four times in the right ear and iqamat three times in the left ear.

Both boys and girls should receive azan and iqamat at birth, not just boys.

On the seventh day of birth:

1. The child should be named
2. The head should be shaved
3. Aqeeqah should be performed
4. Silver or gold equivalent to the weight of the shaved hair should be given as charity

content.content: After shaving the head of the child, it is better to rub ground saffron on the head.

body.content:
For a boy: Two billy goats (male animals)

For a girl: One nanny goat (female animal)

However, there is no harm if nanny goats are slaughtered for a boy or a billy goat for a girl.
